column2: Proportion of population living below the national poverty line
Percentage of population of Bristol, disaggregated by children and elderly living below national poverty line
Households are considered to be below the UK poverty line if their income is 60% below the median household income after housing costs for that year
No calculations were performed in the data acquisition of this indicator as appropriate data was readily available in the final format specified by this indicator.
